page.title: 12Mill at Thornton
page.content: The mill, owned by the Burgess family since 1920, has 65 employees, and stands on the same site as the mill mentioned in the original Domesday Book.It covers an area of 5 acres and the owners have progressively modernised the building rather than re-build it. {Changes.}In 1900 it was a water mill powered by water from the beck. In 1915 it was modernised, and in 1948 converted to electrical power. Since 1963 it has stopped milling flour and has changed to the production of animal feeds. {Sales.}Animal feed for cows, pigs, sheep, rabbits, dogs and calves is transported all over Yorkshire and Durham. About 80% is sold in bulk, and 20% in bags. Each bag weighs approximately 25 kilograms.
